cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Charleston South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, then forecast to turn northeast and accelerate parallel to the U.S. East Coast, passing near the North Carolina coast tonight/Friday, then southeast of New England and toward Nova Scotia

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is posted north of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, portions of Chesapeake Bay and coastal Massachusetts (Woods Hole to Sagamore Beach, Nantucket, Martha’s Vineyard).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Savannah River GA to NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and lower Chesapeake Bay; Storm Surge Warning Savannah River SC to Poquoson VA including sounds and rivers.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from Georgia through the Carolinas, expanding north-eastward toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England shoreline.
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional squalls and breezy conditions (25–35 mph gusts) possible as outer bands pass well offshore; damaging winds are no longer expected at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – surge warnings are north of Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief showers; totals generally under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Persistent high surf and dangerous rip currents along the Palm Beach shoreline for the next 24–36 hours.
